did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Cumberland County (Va.) List of Fee Bills Due to the Clerk of Fluvanna County from Persons Residing in Cumberland County, 1819

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cumberland County (Va.) List of Fee Bills Due to the Clerk of Fluvanna County from Persons Residing in Cumberland County, 1819, Local government records collection, Cumberland County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia under accession number 43464.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Cumberland County was named for William Augustus, duke of Cumberland, third son of George II. It was formed from Goochland County in 1749.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Cumberland County (Va.) List of Fee Bills Due to the Clerk of Fluvanna County from Persons Residing in Cumberland County, 1819. The document contains a list of names of individuals who owe money to the Fluvanna County Court, the amount each person owes, and the date the fee was accrued. Also included is an acknowledgement from the Cumberland County Clerk of his intent to collect the fees according to law.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Cumberland County Court Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm.
